units.title: Organoid initiation in 96-well plates
units.text: organids were generated in 96-well plates, where pluripotent stem cells (WTC, H9 and HES3 lines) were aggregated into embryoid bodies and cultured in minimal neural induction media (MNIM) to induce neuroectodermal fates (Fig. 1a).
units.rationale: Specifies the initial aggregation and culture conditions for organoid formation.

units.title: Pooling and single‑cell preparation
units.text: each condition (Supplementary Fig. 1) were pooled and dissociated into single-cell suspensions, followed by cell hashing with barcoded antibodies and processing for single-cell transcriptome sequencing (3′ mRNA, 10x Genomics; Fig. 1b).
units.rationale: Details the steps to generate single‑cell libraries for scRNA‑seq.

units.title: Application of morphogen concentration gradients
units.text: We apply concentration gradients in microfluidic chips or increasing static concentrations in multi-well plates and observe different patterning dynamics in each scenario.
units.rationale: Describes the two delivery methods used to expose organoids to morphogens.

units.title: Quantifying patterning heterogeneity
units.text: We measured the heterogeneity of each patterning condition using the Shannon diversity index, where lower scores indicate lower cell-type diversity.
units.rationale: Provides the metric used to assess cell‑type composition across conditions.

units.title: In situ hybridization chain reaction validation
units.text: In situ hybridization chain reaction (HCR) stainings confirmed the presence of more retinal progenitors (SFRP2+) at lower RA concentrations and more ventralized and posterior fates (FOXA2+) at higher RA concentrations.
units.rationale: Shows how spatial marker expression was validated after morphogen treatment.

units.title: Short‑pulse morphogen delivery
units.text: We supplied sonic hedgehog (SHH), WNT, FGF8, retinoic acid (RA), BMP4 and BMP7 pathway modulators in short pulses over different time windows to induce substantial changes in organoid composition.
units.rationale: Outlines the temporal pattern of morphogen exposure used to drive fate changes.

units.title: Cell hashing‑based multiplexed scRNA‑seq
units.text: We used cell hashing-based multiplexed scRNA-seq to assess neural progenitor regionalization after 3 weeks in culture.
units.rationale: Specifies the sequencing approach for profiling regional identities.

units.title: Data integration and dimensionality reduction
units.text: We integrated the data using reference similarity spectrum (RSS)27 and embedded the dataset with uniform manifold approximation and projection (UMAP)29 (Fig. 1c–e).
units.rationale: Describes computational steps for combining and visualizing the single‑cell data.

units.title: Experimental workflow for systematic testing
units.text: We established an experimental workflow to systematically test the timing, concentration and combinations of patterning molecules using cell hashing-based multiplexed scRNA-seq.
units.rationale: Summarizes the overall design for evaluating multiple morphogen parameters.
